column5: any general info on the Lake such as species,water depth,heavily vegatated,available bait and ramps would be appreciated. I would really like to give it a try  maybe even tomorrow. thanks

Puslinch info: Puslinch lake is the largest kettle lake in North America. There are pike, walleye, largemouth, crappie, perch, bluegill, sunfish, rockbass, catfish and carp. Deepest spot I've found was 22ft. Heavily weeded. No bait. One ramp on the north shore at McLintock's Landing. Wear your PFD, this lake has taken two people already this year.  Good luck.
